item.title: About Me
item.description: I am Aravind, trained as an engineer and applied mathematician, and now working as a neuroscientist. At the core of my work is a long-standing curiosity about how systems evolve over time and why they behave the way they do. This naturally led me to dynamical systems theory, which forms the backbone of my research. Real-world systems are rarely linear, predictable, or noise-free — and that is precisely what makes them interesting. My work therefore focuses on nonlinear and stochastic dynamical systems, both as mathematical objects and as tools for understanding complex biological phenomena.
